message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IR, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.DC 

The paper discusses security and privacy issues in the context of IoT, which is a common topic in the cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) sub-category. The paper also proposes a new architecture for IoT security and privacy, which involves context-awareness and dynamic composition of micro services, making it relevant to the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category. The paper also mentions the support for generic IoT applications, particularly for smart city, which falls under the cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) sub-category. The paper also discusses the challenges in implementing security mechanisms for IoT devices, which is relevant to the cs.SE (Software Engineering) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a knowledge plane for effective management of context-awareness, which is relevant to the cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) sub-category.
